reviews.review_msg: Professor Marshall is kind and always makes herself available to her students. Her lectures are always very engaging, and she creates the course in a way that makes you want to come to class. You will be going to the library and checking out books every single week for this course. Overall, can't say enough about Prof Marshall! She's fabulous!

Beth's class was the best I've taken at SFU and I would take her again in a heartbeat if I could. You'll be spending a lot of time outside of class going to public libraries and doing readings, but it's a very manageable workload. Participation is also a MUST, so if you're too shy to talk in front of others this might not be the class for you

Education 465 was THE BEST course I have ever taken at SFU. Despite being at 8:30 in the morning I looked forward to every class we had. The content is engaging and pretty easy. I would take it again if I could. Beth is the best professor ever.
Beth is amazing!!!!

Beth is not only a great professor but a lovely human in general. She makes an effort to connect with each student personally. It is evident she has a passion for what she teaches. Classes are discussion heavy and require full participation, but material is fun and engaging and as long as you keep up passing the course is basically guaranteed.

You MUST participate as there are many group discussions in every class. Be prepared for many library trips. Option to attend separate events (class/book-related with children's lit scholars, authors, or illustrators) outside of class time as a partial or full substitution for midterm and final. Mini assignments throughout. Love Dr. Marshall!

Beth is amazing professor that I would definitely seek for other courses that she teaches. She provides inspiring and thought provoking course contents every lecture which I learnt numerous stuffs. Her wit and warm characteristics created a nice environment that allow students to step into conversation easily.

Beth is a fantastic professor. Her special topics course is very interesting and I really enjoyed our topics. I learned a lot! I will warn you that if you are looking for an easy A, you may want to rethink the course. This is not one of those educ courses. There is a lot of reading and writing and you will need to work for it, but you will learn!

Beth is an intelligent moderator who encourages discussion. Attendance is mandatory in her class and it's often early (8:30 start) but it's worth it. One downside is you have to purchase / find several books every week which eat up your time. But she gives a ton of leeway with a free 5% and easy quizzes. MT and final are moderately difficult.

Not a morning person, but she had me engaged for an 8:30 class. Passionate instructor, confident in what she teaches. Lots of character. You do have to put in effort to do well, PARTICIPATE in class and put effort into those DA's. Expect to make MANY trips to the library, START EARLY when finding specific books. Midterm & Final are a breeze.

best prof i've ever had. engaging materials & good class dynamic. participate, pay attention & do the readings and the online exams will be a breeze. she listens to your feedback & is willing to make accommodations where needed. weekly/sometimes daily responses aren't hard to do because it's mostly your own opinion- just construct them well

Super engaging class. Cares about your thoughts & achievement. Participation is huge- talk, even if you don't think it's worth saying! Be ready to visit public library often for books. Quizzes/assignments were fair but final project was more work than anticipated/ given less instruction- grading seemed unfair/odd on project but overall GREAT PROF

Dr. Marshall sets her students up for success. She is absolutely hilarious, compassionate and relatable. A one-of-a-kind prof & no one can surpass her as an instructor. Her class is VERY useful for prospective teachers, but if you're not going into PDP, take her class anyways. Well worth waking up early for (8:30 am class)! You wont regret it!

I took this class as an UD elective and I'm so glad I did! Lots of discussions and you get to know everyone in the class, so it isn't too bad. You will learn a lot about children's lit and there's quite a bit of writing and prep work involved. As long as you keep up to speed with your work, you will do great! She made it very enjoyable. Recommend!

I took Beth's class during my undergrad to bring up my GPA for law school, thinking it would be an 'easy' class. Wrong, it was a lot of reading, pop quizzes, I got yelled at for texting in class and talking twice... but I loved this class looking back. She was awesome, the books we read were awesome, it was such a good class!!

Beth is awesome! She is interested in what she teaches and wants her students to succeed. She's clear with course requirements and very organized. A lot of reading, but if you show up and do the readings, the class will be great for you. 10/10 would recommend!

Beth is THE best, but only if you like class discussions. If you aren't a talker, then start being one! It was a small class and I felt like I was friends with everyone. 396 was intersession so it's a lot of work, but actually it's easy (only major items were a midterm + final, both take-home). We get to read books and watch movies for this class!

Beth Marshall makes her class FUN! A class that I didn't mind that started at 8:30am nor that it was 4 hours. She always had something to discuss or activities to do which encouraged our learning experience. Great class, highly recommend.

Beth is a great prof! Her love for literature is so strong that I can't wait to use books with students in all subjects. She gives practical examples of what can be applied in teaching. There were a lot of readings to do and assignments were fair. Only down side is you may end up spending a lot buying books or have to visit the library every week!

Beth is amazing.  The content, she makes it inherently interesting and brings ideas that you would never think of.  She, herself, is full of energy, sarcasm and wit that you don't often find in a lot of teachers.  There is reading and there is homework, but it's very manageable.  Nothing extreme.  A gem among professors.

Beth is awesome! She is super passionate about literature and it is so evident. She clearly works hard to make her class interesting and relevant and I really enjoyed her lessons, the material, and assignments. I wouldn't recommend this class to those looking for an easy course, there is a lot of reading and you have to work for your grades.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU DO NOT LIKE CLASS DISCUSSIONS.  She will not like you.  The rest of the class will probably not like you either because it's pretty small and we always do group work.  Personally, it was my favourite class in all my years at SFU.  Highly recommend if you're looking to challenge yourself and love reading.
Loved this class! Alot of reading but really worth it. Beth is great one of the best profs ive ever had!

AMAZING Prof. Really enjoyed this course! Weekly assignments, quizzes, projects and final so you can play to your strengths. Lots of discussion and reading but well worth the course! Learned so much and enjoyed all the activities and guest lecturers! Definitely recommend. Favourite Professor by FAR.

Don't bother taking this class if you aren't serious. It isn't just to "coast". Course is tough, but super-interesting. Dr. Marshall makes it fun with lots of media and examples from everyday pop culture. She's a great teacher!

This class was awesome! The material and lectures were super interesting. Lots of class discussion. The work is challenging but definitely worth it. I would definitely recommend this class to anyone who is keen and willing to put in the work.
Very engaging lecturer. Awesome course

Super interesting class. Engaging discussion. Fun and reputable prof. Uses the text and practically applies it. Excellent way to fulfill "w" requirement and learn about education. highly recommend it!
This class is interesting and fun, but there is a lot of weekly written work that takes plenty of time to complete. It should get a "W" designation from the department.
